definition: to take office/to assume a post

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: He is due to be formally inaugurated in front of parliament on Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 艾哈邁迪內賈德星期三將在伊朗議會上正式就任總統。

sentences.english: Professor Lawrence J. Lau was installed as the sixth Vice-Chancellor of The Chinese University of Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 劉遵義教授就任香港中文大學第六任校長。

sentences.english: He rode to office, unelected, thanks to the yellow shirts.
sentences.chinese: 由於黃衫軍的示威暴亂，他未經選舉就任總理。

sentences.english: Camacho to coach national soccer team.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙人卡馬喬就任中國足球教練。

sentences.english: Konare became Mali's President on June 8th this year.
sentences.chinese: 杜爾是今年6月8日就任馬裏總統的。

sentences.english: Way allow not agree with the little mother to take office, and father quarreled.
sentences.chinese: 道允不同意小媽去就任儀式，和父親吵了起來。

sentences.english: Burmese prince was again installed as a vassal of Ava .
sentences.chinese: 一個緬甸王子更新就任阿瓦的封臣。

sentences.english: Then she could take her seat on the Supreme Court when it meets in October.
sentences.chinese: 這樣在最高法院十月與會時，埃琳娜可以順利就任。

sentences.english: Accession shall be subject to approval of two-third vote of the Directors of the Governing Body.
sentences.chinese: 就任須得到董事會三分之二以上的成員同意。

sentences.english: He came to the bench with no particular ideology.
sentences.chinese: 他就任大法官職務時不帶有特定的意識形態。

sentences.english: There was talk by the Zetas that Obama might come foward about PX after he was inaugurated.
sentences.chinese: 齊塔人談話曾說過奧巴馬在就任之後可能公佈極移。

sentences.english: Dr Chan will take office on 4 January 2007.
sentences.chinese: 陳博士將於2007年1月4日正式就任。

sentences.english: And when I am President, that’s what we will do.
sentences.chinese: 這就是我就任總統後所將採取的舉措。

sentences.english: If they succeed then Mr. Tsvangirai will be sworn into office.
sentences.chinese: 如果這輪談判成功，那麼茨萬吉拉伊將宣誓就任總理。

sentences.english: The soon-to-be President practices the way he will take the oath of office.
sentences.chinese: 這位即將就任的總統在練習他即將進行的就職宣誓。

sentences.english: And what's new at HP Labs since Léo has been on the job?
sentences.chinese: 自從李艾科就任後，惠普實驗室有什麼新變化嗎？

definition: to take over (as minister, manager etc)
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
to leave office
to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to take office/previous (incumbent)/predecessor
to be promoted to
to swear the oath of office
to appoint
to succeed sb in a job/successor
to transfer/to move to another post
to take over/to take control
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
to hold an office or post
term of office/CL:屆|届[jie4]/tenure (entire period in office)
period in office
